data.title: Smoked Brisket Jerky
data.text: Brisket was dry, steak was mediocre, not sure why this place has such a great reputation. The food and menu really was lacking. In my opinion.

data.title: So so
data.text: The service was terrible  constantly had empty drinks & the nachos were way to salty. Nice atmosphere but that's about it.

data.title: Great brisket and better service
data.text: Had the brisket and rib combo. Ribs weren't to my liking but the brisket was great. Also had the onion rings that were billed as billings best and the weren't wrong. Karla was our friendly server who did a great job. Well done

data.title: Great atmosphere
data.text: A unique historic downtown building. Great staff. Food was excellent but three steak prices were ridiculous. We had cattle breeders from Montana, Pennsylvania, New York and South Dakota in the group. None of us found the prices acceptable. I would eat here again but I'll never try the steak at those prices.

data.title: Bison Filet!
data.text: This dinner was amazing!  Bartender and waitstaff were friendly and informative.  This was one of the best steaks we have ever had!! We also had shrimp wontons and ahi tuna at the bar before dinner - delicious!  (Watch out for the hot mustard!)

data.title: Requested Beef Wellington...Chef made it especially for us celebrating my birthday.
data.text: Awesome dining room.  The owner,the Chef, the staff and of course, the waitress excellent and attentive.  Always will recommend the Rex..

data.title: Nice setting, not so nice food.
data.text: I love this restaurant's interior, location and patio, but the food is never that great in my experience.  If you go, the best, most consistent thing I've had there is the barbecue.

data.title: Ms
data.text: I was really excited to see this turn of the century restaurant. I still haven't! The lounge was open but not the restaurant, we peeked inside  but didn't see anything that stood out. The food was ok but not great. I had beer cheese soup, my suggestion would be to add some beer and turn down the heat so it doesn't curdle so much. The brisket had been cut way too soon before service, it was quite dry. Our waitress was great, friendly, sociable and prompt. All in all I think I'll miss this next trip.

data.title: Terrible service
data.text: This is a very expensive restaurant for what you get. I ordered fried shrimp with mashed potatoes and a salad. She brought my salad but no ranch dressing. I told her and she never brought it. She came back and said they were out of mash potatoes, so I told her french fries with catsup and I needed ranch dressing. She brought my plate....still no ranch dressing and she asked if something was wrong with the salad and I told her I was still waiting on the ranch dressing. She never brought it. I asked for catsup and cocktail sauce. There were only 5 very small shrimp and on my last one she brought the cocktail sauce. Still no ranch dressing or catsup. She never said she was sorry or anything. I would never go back to this place. 5 shrimp cost $27.95.

data.title: Delicious lunch on the road
data.text: We ate at Rex today as we were traveling to Glacier National Park. I had the Chicken Quesadilla and my husband had the Buffalo Burger. Both were delicious and eating outside on the patio was the perfect atmosphere for two weary travellers.

data.title: Steak's around
data.text:
Saw this place on Travel Channel sometime back and booked based on the high recommendation.  Sat outside on patio and wait staff was very attentive and friendly.  Took our order right away and refilled our bar order without us asking.  

Food was delivered in timely manner; but I guess I was expecting the prime rib to just bowl me over.  Not.  While tender it was a very thin cut ( almost time a breakfast steak) and taste was simply average.  Guess I'll start questioning the rave reviews on TC going forward. 

First visit to Billings area.  Loved the downtown area and the people are very friendly.

data.title: Good BBQ Place in the Historic District!
data.text: Our first time in Billings and we chose REX because of the decent menu choices and fair prices. I ordered the BabyBack Ribs and Chicken combo which came with Bourbon BBQ Beans, Coleslaw and freshly baked bread. My husband ordered the Smoker Sampler: Brisket, Hot Link, Chicken, Ribs and Garlic Bread. Our food was very tasty, our server was attentive and the fun, neighborhood atmosphere was enjoyable. I would recommend REX if you love BBQ!

data.title: Eat here! Buffalo Filet Mignot! Mmm!
data.text:
Family road trip and we ate here before our destination. We were traveling from Manitoba, a long 14 hour drive along the interstate, but with a bit of research for a local non-chain steak house serving Buffalo - this was the place to try out. 

We checked in to our accommodations and headed downtown. Downtown Billings was full of people and action, there was a. Music festival across the street, and people hanging on the patio at The Rex.

My son and I both ordered the Buffalo filet Mignot (as we wanted to get in touch with our Sioux Indian roots before heading to the Battle of Little Bighorn monument), and they cooked it to order. 

The meat was wrapped in bacon, grilled, and sprinkled with blue cheese and a sauce. It worked! As Buffalo can be pretty dry, so they made up for it. 

The side potatoe and veggies were good as well.

The Caesar salad was good (will lay off the anchovies), and the croutons were good. 

The onion rings were awesome. And, the house white wine paired well for the heat.

We were bone-tired, but The Rex provided   Great food and great service for these bone-weary travellers.

Two steaks, two glasses of wine, and an appetizer came to $100 bucks!

Decor okay.

data.title: Average food in a nice quieter atmosphere.
data.text: We have been here for New Year's Eve dinner and Sunday Brunch.  Slightly above average food but not worth the extra money you spend to get it.  Had reservations for New Year's Eve and had to wait about 45 minutes to be seated.

data.title: Good food great service
data.text: I went to Rex with 14 people and we all had a great time. The food was very good and the lady who served us was great and so nice. We had our own room and we loved the space. The prices were very fair. I would highly recommend it.

data.title: Excellent Lunch Outside on the Patio
data.text: We met several friends here for lunch while visiting Billings.  We had a very nice lunch outside on the patio.  Our food was excellent and so was the service.  I highly recommend eating here while in Billings.

data.title: BEST ONION RINGS EVER!
data.text: Have only eaten there twice, however both times everyone in our party of four really enjoyed their food. Both times we ate out on the patio which was very nice. The server was friendly and helpful. I will go out of my way to eat there again.

data.title: Great food but the wrong night
data.text: After a long day of travel we wanted a pet friendly restaurant & their patio allows leashed dogs.  It was a wonderful evening but our waitress had a party of 30 inside & a party of 15 on the patio.  We waited 30 minutes before even getting a glass of water.  It did not start out good but the manager asked if we had been taken care of & apologized, took our drink order which he comped for us & found another waitress to take up the slack.  I had a chicken cobb salad which was enormous & very good, the hubby had the portobello chicken sandwich again very good.  The sweet potato fries were delicious.  My daughter had a steak salad.  All of our entrees were plenty enough for 2 but we were all hungry & ate every last bit.  If we are ever come back to the  area  I would definitely try Rex again.

data.title: Great food, extremely noisy.
data.text: The Red has great food but the restaurant is extremely noisy unless you go really early. Tables are rather close together so does not feel very private so not so good for date night.

data.title: Outstanding Sevice
data.text: Special shout out to our server, Kale!!  We were tired and hungry from a long day of travel.  He was so nice and helpful with his suggestions.  He took excellent care of us.  Food was good.  This was a great choice for weary travelers!
